text: oh this is Bill Cunningham and it has
been a rather sad week
with the passing of oscar de la renta
and yet it brought into a very sharp
focus what is appropriate attire for
funerals memorial services and it's a
question that has been thrown into
turmoil with the mix of fashion at the
start of the 21st century but last
Saturday morning biking to the farmers
market down Fifth Avenue I was startled
and stopped jumped off my bike at 9:30 I
saw outside st. Thomas's church very
elegantly dressed women in all black
that seemed strange at this hour and a
sad day and one of the guests in for me
that indeed it was a memorial service
for Elaine Ford the model agency head
who died last July at 92 and they were
having a memorial service her family and
500 guests at least 300 them had to be
former or present date models of the
Ford modeling agency and their choice of
clothing for this memorial such sharp
contrast to other people on Fifth Avenue
it showed the question of what is
appropriate at a time of sadness or
celebration of life whichever way you
want it then on Monday evening the
Metropolitan Museum unveiled a very
elegant very small exhibition of the
very rigid style of mourning dress of
the 19th century the third element that
brought all of this into
focus was the death of Oscar de la Renta
Monday night for the rest of the week
the guests attending benefit dinners and
balls yet in New York and Sur a
surprising number of women wearing Oscar
de la Renta dresses and they said to me
oh this is in memory of Oscar and we
reached back in my closet and brought it
out and I thought how marvelous what a
way to celebrate a life that was well
lived and created such beauty and
clothes for women to wear back at the
Metropolitan Museum one realized with a
display of mourning hats from late in
the nineteenth century how obsolete the
hat is there were only one woman that
wearing a formal mourning hat at the
Ford memorial service what interested me
was look at the models common and many
other women accented their black pant
suits or dresses with AB scoff christie
brinkley put a red black and red in
black and white print scarf to lighten
it up other women wore she all shades a
whole spectrum of Gray's too white
it was lovely lovely touch I mean it was
it showed it brought to the Ford
memorial service the decorum that mrs.
Ford brought to the modeling world
